data.name: Aberrant Latte
descriptions: This appears to be some kind of organo-metallic entity, made from a strange mosaic of organic tissue, conventional material, and an exotic matter that defies conventional analysis.
This variant in particular seems to be as close to the baseline as can be expected from such a strange creature.

data.name: Aberrant Chomper
descriptions: This appears to be some kind of organo-metallic entity, made from a strange mosaic of organic tissue, conventional material, and an exotic matter that defies conventional analysis.
This variant in particular seems to be much more heavily armed than most others of its kind.

data.name: Aberrant Pileup
descriptions: This appears to be some kind of organo-metallic entity, made from a strange mosaic of organic tissue, conventional material, and an exotic matter that defies conventional analysis.
This variant in particular seems to be somewhat larger and sturdier than others.

data.name: Aberrant Hugger
descriptions: This appears to be some kind of organo-metallic entity, made from a strange mosaic of organic tissue, conventional material, and an exotic matter that defies conventional analysis.
This variant in particular seems to be lighter and capable of higher speeds than most other Aberrant ships, yet it still carries an enlarged armament.

data.name: Aberrant Longfellow
descriptions: This appears to be some kind of organo-metallic entity, made from a strange mosaic of organic tissue, conventional material, and an exotic matter that defies conventional analysis.
This variant in particular seems to have grown extra thrusters around a lean, sleek fuselage.

data.name: Aberrant Dancer
descriptions: This appears to be some kind of organo-metallic entity, made from a strange mosaic of organic tissue, conventional material, and an exotic matter that defies conventional analysis.
This variant in particular appears to have several hardpoints designed to mount turrets.

data.name: Aberrant Junior
descriptions: This appears to be some kind of organo-metallic entity, made from a strange mosaic of organic tissue, conventional material, and an exotic matter that defies conventional analysis.
This variant in particular seems to be compact, smaller-than-average, and still in the process of growing.

data.name: Aberrant Icebreaker
descriptions: This appears to be some kind of organo-metallic entity, made from a strange mosaic of organic tissue, conventional material, and an exotic matter that defies conventional analysis.
This variant in particular seems to be in the process of growing more elongated, and has a tougher hull than most other variants.

data.name: Aberrant Pike
descriptions: This appears to be some kind of organo-metallic entity, made from a strange mosaic of organic tissue, conventional material, and an exotic matter that defies conventional analysis.
This variant in particular has grown into a sleek, elongated shape.

data.name: Aberrant Mole
descriptions: This appears to be some kind of organo-metallic entity, made from a strange mosaic of organic tissue, conventional material, and an exotic matter that defies conventional analysis.
This variant has grown a sharp, bladed prow capable of fitting more forward weapons.

data.name: Aberrant Whiskers
descriptions: This appears to be some kind of organo-metallic entity, made from a strange mosaic of organic tissue, conventional material, and an exotic matter that defies conventional analysis.
This variant in particular appears to be growing some sort of tail-like structure, increasing its agility.

data.name: Aberrant Trip
descriptions: This appears to be some kind of organo-metallic entity, made from a strange mosaic of organic tissue, conventional material, and an exotic matter that defies conventional analysis.
Something appears to have gone terribly wrong in the germination of this variant. It is a lopsided, deformed mass of malformed material, which survives only through sheer luck.

data.name: Aberrant Triplet
descriptions: This appears to be some kind of organo-metallic entity, made from a strange mosaic of organic tissue, conventional material, and an exotic matter that defies conventional analysis.
This variant seems to be a composite of two or three individuals, fused together into a single mass.

data.name: Maeri'het
descriptions: The Maeri is the smallest Het ship created by the Builders' stations, a prime example of the genetic technology they once possessed. Its small size is compensated by the fact that it can hide its location from most types of sensors.

data.name: Telis'het
descriptions: When the Builders designed the exoskeleton of the Telis, they came to the conclusion that it would have been impossible to make it resilient enough without compromising its agility and integrity. Instead, they focused heavily on improving their shield technology, giving the Telis many of their regenerators.

data.name: Vareti'het
descriptions: The Vareti was the strongest Het the Builders were able to complete, starting its mass production only a year before the beginning of the invasion. It relies on shield matrixes even more than its little brothers, using larger and more effective restorers that were developed alongside this project.

data.name: Selii'mar
descriptions: The Selii'mar was a common Builder mining drone, one of the few automated ships they ever produced. The Het stations still produce them, in order to harvest the materials they need to keep working.
Drones do not come equipped with a hyperdrive. You cannot carry a drone unless you have a ship in your fleet with a drone bay.

data.name: Faes'mar
descriptions: The Mar were the last and most successful ships of the Builders in their attempts at creating automatic drones. Today only the Het stations are still aware of their blueprints, and keep producing the Faes'mar to transport the resources mined to the station's cargo bay.
Drones do not come equipped with a hyperdrive. You cannot carry a drone unless you have a ship in your fleet with a drone bay.

data.name: Fetri'sei
descriptions: The Fetri is a self replicating probe, built to harvest iridium away from the Graveyard and transport it back to the Builders.
